abstract: Managing the North American power grid is seen as increasingly tough and essential field; more than 100 operators staff control rooms for nation's electricity grid, whose split-second decisions keep power flowing; 40 percent of energy used in United States is turned into electricity before it is consumed.
snippet: In anonymous buildings, the control rooms for the nation’s electricity grid are staffed by operators whose split-second decisions keep the power humming.
lead_paragraph: In anonymous buildings, the control rooms for the nation’s electricity grid are staffed by operators whose split-second decisions keep the power humming.

headline.main: On the Front Lines of the Power Grid
headline.print_headline: On the Front Lines of the Power Grid
headline.seo: Behind the Power Grid, Humans With High-Stakes Jobs
